intro: Megalastrum oreophilum, commonly known as the mountain starflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willowherbs and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in mountainous ecosystems.
